change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 99/2016, effective November 28, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Higher voting threshold in bylaws of society
bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 11 (4) [bylaws] of the Societies Act applies in relation to a society only if the bylaws of the society provide for the higher voting threshold, referred to in that section, in one of the following ways:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by specifically setting out the higher voting threshold as a fraction or percentage of the votes cast or as a specific number of votes;
by specifically requiring a unanimous vote or the consent in writing of all of the voting members;
by specifically setting out a formula for calculating the higher voting threshold.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Societies Act, S.B.C. 2015, c. 18, section 251]
